meanings.definition: The quality of being deceptive or misleading.
meanings.sent1: Her deceptivenesses made it hard to trust her.
meanings.sent2: The deceptivenesses of the advertisement were exposed by the consumer watchdog.
meanings.sent3: The magician's deceptivenesses left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: The deceptivenesses of the calm waters hid the dangerous currents underneath.
meanings.sent5: The deceptivenesses of the chameleon's camouflage amazed the biologist.

meanings.definition: The act or practice of deceiving or misleading.
meanings.sent1: His deceptivenesses were finally revealed when the truth came out.
meanings.sent2: The deceptivenesses of the con artist led to many people losing their savings.
meanings.sent3: The deceptivenesses of the prankster's tricks always kept his friends on their toes.
meanings.sent4: The deceptivenesses of the spy's cover story were uncovered by the intelligence agency.
meanings.sent5: The deceptivenesses of the mirage in the desert fooled the weary travelers.
